alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 9:09AM CST until February 05 at 2:40PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Cherokee. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 AM CST, Reporting gauges indicate elevated levels along the Chattooga River Above Weiss Lake. This will cause lowland flooding along the Chattooga River Above Weiss Lake. - River levels are expected to crest today and fall below minor flood stage tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cedar Bluff, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake and Western Weiss Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
